item.title: Route 66 at Harvester Park - discoverdupage.com
item.description: The park’s Route 66-themed playground replicates real roadside attractions found along the historic highway—including a custom-built, 30-foot-tall Chicago skyscraper—and invites visitors to explore, climb, splash, and discover.

item.title: Route 66 Park | TravelOK.com - Oklahoma's Official Travel & Tourism Site
item.description: Route 66 Park sits along the shores of Lake Overholser in Oklahoma City. This 148-acre park celebrates historic Route 66 while providing a place for families to enjoy outdoor activities.

item.title: Route 66 Park in Joliet, Illinois - sillyamerica.com
item.description: Joliet kicks on 66, and so can you. Stop at Route 66 Park in Joliet, Illinois to stretch your legs, get some ice cream, admire a historic prison, and maybe sing the blues.

item.title: Route 66 Park (2026) - All You MUST Know Before You Go ... - Tripadvisor
item.description: A well kept and nice roadside park, with lots of good information signs. Lots of history for you to read over with the history roadway. Very fun place.

item.title: Route 66 maps from start to finish, interactive Route 66 maps, Route 66 ...
item.description: Maps of entire Route 66 segments, states and cities, from start in Chicago to end in Santa Monica

item.title: Visit - Travel Route 66 (U.S. National Park Service)
item.description: There are more than 250 buildings, bridges, road alignments and other sites along Route 66 that are listed on the National Register of Historic Places. This travel itinerary highlights over 100 of those sites, and is part of the National Park Service's Share Our Heritage Travel Itineray series.

item.title: Official U.S. Route 66 Centennial
item.description: This is the official National U.S. Route 66 Centennial website celebrating the history, the people and the future of the Mother Road.

item.title: Route 66 Park | Oklahoma City, OK - Visit OKC
item.description: Nestled on the west side of Lake Overholser just a few blocks from the original highway, Route 66 Park features a watchtower, a rent-able park shelter, amphitheater, fishing wetlands, a skate court and its own walkable version of the historic highway. Open daily. Admission: Free.

item.title: Free Route 66 Interactive Map and Route Planner
item.description: Interactive map presented by https://www.Route66RoadTrip.com of popular cities and attractions along Historic Route 66, the Mother Road, from Chicago to Santa Monica.

item.title: Travel Guide to Route 66: The Mother Road
item.description: Travel planning for a road trip in 2026 on Historic U.S. Route 66, photos, maps, travel information, hotels, and things to see
